keyword: how many calories are in sperm
title: How Many Calories Are in Sperm?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in sperm per average ejaculation, including protein, carbs, fat, and other nutrients for curiosity or health tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Sperm?
assumptions: Average human male ejaculation (~3-5 ml of semen, as 'sperm' commonly refers to semen volume); composition based on typical fructose, protein, and water content; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by individual health, diet, hydration, frequency, and volume; these are approximate averages. Consult medical sources for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: An average ejaculation contains about 20 kcal, mostly from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Higher volume ejaculation (5 ml vs. 3 ml average)

faqs.q: How many calories are in sperm per ejaculation?
faqs.a: Approximately 20 kcal for an average 3-5 ml ejaculation.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in sperm besides calories?
faqs.a: Mainly 2 g carbs (sugars like fructose), 1 g protein, trace fat, and about 150 mg sodium.

faqs.q: Does sperm have protein for nutrition?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1 g per ejaculation, but it's not a significant dietary source.

faqs.q: How many calories in a teaspoon of sperm?
faqs.a: About 5-10 kcal per teaspoon (5 ml), depending on concentration.

faqs.q: Can diet affect calories in sperm?
faqs.a: Yes, higher sugar intake may increase fructose content and calories slightly.
